Paragraph: Quinine is known to block voltage - , calcium - and ATP - sensitive K ( + ) - channels while 4 - aminopyridine is known to block voltage - sensitive K ( + ) - channels .

| ATP |
| 4 - aminopyridine |

Quinine is known to block voltage-sensitive K+(+)-channels, calcium-, and ATP-sensitive K+(+)-channels.
4-aminopyridine is known to block voltage-sensitive K+(+)-channels.

Therefore, the precise entities mentioned in the paragraph are Quinine, Calcium, ATP, and 4-aminopyridine.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Quinine is known to block voltage-sensitive K+(+)-channels, calcium-sensitive K+(+)-channels, and ATP-sensitive K+(+)-channels.
4-aminopyridine is known to block voltage-sensitive K+(+)-channels.

The entities mentioned in the paragraph that clearly refer to chemicals are Quinine, Calcium, ATP, and 4-aminopyridine. Calcium and ATP are inorganic ions, but they are often considered as chemicals in a biological context.
